title: Phase 1: Core Substrate
description:
Build the foundational substrate for GBE.

## Deliverables
- gbe-router: Message broker for routing between components
- gbe-adapter: Universal wrapper for any Unix command
- gbe-buffer: Storage layer (rope for files, ring for streams)
- gbe-client: Terminal UI with ratatui
- Protocol: Message definitions and serialization
- Text interface: Bash-like shell experience

## Success Criteria
- Can wrap any Unix command via adapter
- Message passing latency <10ms
- Sessions survive disconnects
- Smooth terminal rendering (no flicker)

## Gate Criteria
- [ ] All tasks complete
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] No code smells
- [ ] User review and acceptance

## References
- Architecture: notes/ARCHITECTURE.md (Phase 5 → Phase 1 section)
- Parent: gbe-mva

title: Phase 1 Completion Gate
description:
Gate criteria that must be met before Phase 1 can be marked complete.

## Checklist
- [ ] All Phase 1 tasks complete
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] No code smells (clippy, formatting, best practices)
- [ ] User review completed
- [ ] User acceptance received

## Verification Steps
1. Run: `cargo test --workspace` (all passing)
2. Run: `cargo clippy --workspace` (no warnings)
3. Run: `cargo fmt --check` (clean)
4. Manual review of code quality
5. User approval sign-off

## Notes
This gate blocks Phase 1 completion. All other Phase 1 tasks should block this gate.
